slokas.translation: Thus the self-controlled yogī, constantly engaged in yoga practice, becomes free from all material contamination and achieves the highest stage of perfect happiness in transcendental loving service to the Lord.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि । ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: A true yogī observes Me in all beings and also sees every being in Me. Indeed, the self-realized man sees Me everywhere.

slokas.sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति । तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: For one who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost, nor is he ever lost to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः । सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas.translation: Such a yogī, who engages in the worshipful service of the Supersoul, knowing that I and the Supersoul are one, remains always in Me in all circumstances.

slokas.sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन । सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas.translation: He is a perfect yogī who, by comparison to his own self, sees the true equality of all beings, in both their happiness and their distress, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन । एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O Madhusūdana, the system of yoga which You have summarized appears impractical and unendurable to me, for the mind is restless and unsteady.

slokas.sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् । तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas.translation: For the mind is restless, turbulent, obstinate, and very strong, O Kṛṣṇa, and to subdue it is, it seems to me, more difficult than controlling the wind.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः । वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O mighty-armed son of Kuntī, it is undoubtedly very difficult to curb the restless mind, but it is possible by suitable practice and by detachment.

slokas.sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः । वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas.translation: For one whose mind is unbridled, self-realization is difficult work. But he whose mind is controlled, and who strives by right means, is assured of success. That is My opinion.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः । अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, what is the destination of the unsuccessful transcendentalist, who in the beginning takes to the process of self-realization with faith but who later desists due to worldly-mindedness and thus does not attain perfection in mysticism?

slokas.sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति । अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas.translation: Does not such a man, who is bewildered from the path of transcendence, perish like a riven cloud, with no position in any sphere?

slokas.sanskrit: एतान्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः । त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas.translation: This is my doubt, O Kṛṣṇa, and I ask You to dispel it completely. Except for You, no one is to be found who can destroy this doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: पार्थ, न एव इह न अमुत्र विनाशः तस्य विद्यते । न हि कल्याणकृत् कश्चित् दुर्गतिम् तात गच्छति ॥ ४० ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Pārtha, neither in this world nor in the next is there destruction for him; no one who does good, my son, ever comes to a bad end.

slokas.sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुशित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः । शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas.translation: After attaining the worlds of the pious and dwelling there for many years, a yogī who has fallen down from yoga may be born in a family of the pure and prosperous, O son of Bhārata.

slokas.sanskrit: अथवा या कुले जन्म यत्र धर्मो भवति केशव । योगभ्रष्टो भूय एव तत्र कुले भूतविधान् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas.translation: Or (if not) he may take birth in a family where spiritual culture is practiced; there also, being born among devotees, he again revives his previously acquired yogic life.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धि-साम्ययोगं पूर्वाभ्यस्येन भवेत् । तत्रैवैतद्बुद्धिसंयोगं पूर्वजातकवेदितम् ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas.translation: There, by contact with the spiritual practice of that family, he revives the knowledge he had cultivated in his previous life and again strives for perfection.

slokas.sanskrit: पुरोनमफलाद्येन योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते । तेषां व्रजते गणैरपि नाम्ना ग्रहेषु च ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas.translation: By the influence of his previous advancement he is attracted to the practices of yoga even without deliberate seeking; such a person stands above mere ritualistic observances.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः । अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas.translation: But the yogī who, by diligent practice, has become purified of sinful reaction and perfected in many births, attains the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः । कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas.translation: A yogī, I consider to be superior to the ascetics; in my opinion he is superior even to the jñānīs (scholars) and superior to the workers (karmīs). Therefore become a yogī, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषामात्मगतानां नित्यम् । श्रद्दधाना विप्रा श्रेयस्य पात्रानि मनुष्यभ्यो मे मताः ॥ ४७ ॥
slokas.translation: Of all yogīs, the one who always remembers Me with faith, thinking of Me within his heart and worshiping Me with unwavering devotion, I consider to be the highest of practitioners and the most dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यासक्तमना: पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रय: । असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Now hear, O son of Pṛthā, how by practicing yoga in full consciousness of Me, with mind attached to Me, you can know Me in full, free from doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषत: । यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: I shall now declare unto you in full this knowledge, both phenomenal and numinous. Knowing this, nothing further shall remain for you to know.

slokas.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये । यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वत: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: Out of many thousands among men, one may endeavor for perfection, and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.

slokas.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुरखं मनो बुद्धिरेव च । अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence, and false ego—all together these eight constitute My separated material energies.

slokas.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् । जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: Besides this inferior nature, O mighty-armed Arjuna, there is a superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who are exploiting the resources of this material, inferior nature.

slokas.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय । अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगत: प्रभव: प्रलयस्तथा ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: All created beings have their source in these two natures. Of all that is material and all that is spiritual in this world, know for certain that I am both the origin and the dissolution.

slokas.sanskrit: मत्त: परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय । मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: O conqueror of wealth, there is no truth superior to Me. Everything rests upon Me, as pearls are strung on a thread.

slokas.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययो: । प्रणव: सर्ववेदेषु शब्द: खे पौरुषं नृषु ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Kuntī, I am the taste of water, the light of the sun and the moon, the syllable oṁ in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether and ability in man.

slokas.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्ध: पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ । जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: I am the original fragrance of the earth, and I am the heat in fire. I am the life of all that lives, and I am the penances of all ascetics.

slokas.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् । बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Pṛthā, know that I am the original seed of all existences, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the prowess of all powerful men.

slokas.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् । धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire. I am sex life which is not contrary to religious principles, O lord of the Bhāratas.

slokas.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये । मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि नत्वहं तेषु ते मयि ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: Know that all states of being—goodness, passion, and ignorance—are manifested by My energy. I am, in one sense, everything, but I am independent. I am not under the modes of this material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभि: सर्वमिदं जगत् । मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्य: परमव्ययम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: Deluded by the three modes (goodness, passion, and ignorance), the whole world does not know Me, who am above the modes and inexhaustible.

slokas.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया । मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross beyond it.

slokas.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढा: प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमा: । माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: The miscreants, who are grossly foolish, lowest among mankind, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the atheistic nature of demons, do not surrender unto Me.

slokas.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जना: सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन । आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: O Arjuna, four kinds of pious men render devotional service unto Me—the distressed, the desirer of wealth, the inquisitive, and he who is searching for knowledge of the Absolute.

slokas.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते । प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रिय: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: Of these, the one who is in full knowledge and who is always engaged in pure devotional service is the best. For I am very dear to him, and he is dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: उदारा: सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् । आस्थित: स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: All these devotees are undoubtedly magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me I consider verily to dwell in Me. Being engaged in My transcendental service, he attains Me.

slokas.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते । वासुदेव: सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभ: ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: After many births and deaths, he who is actually in knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes and all that is. Such a great soul is very rare.

slokas.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः । तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Those whose intelligence has been stolen by material desires surrender unto demigods and follow the particular rules and regulations of worship according to their own natures.

slokas.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति । तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: I am in everyone’s heart as the Supersoul. As soon as one desires to worship the demigods, I make his faith steady so that he can devote himself to some particular deity.

slokas.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते । लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: Endowed with such a faith, he endeavors to worship a particular demigod and obtains his desires. But in actuality these benefits are bestowed by Me alone.

slokas.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् । देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: Men of small intelligence worship the demigods, and their fruits are limited and temporary. Those who worship the demigods go to the planets of the demigods, but My devotees ultimately reach My supreme planet.

slokas.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धय: । परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: Unintelligent men, who do not know Me perfectly, think that I was impersonal before and have now assumed this personality. Due to their small knowledge, they do not know My higher nature, which is imperishable and supreme.

slokas.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाश: सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृत: । मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them I am covered by My eternal creative potency (yoga-māyā); and so the deluded world knows Me not, who am unborn and infallible.

slokas.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन । भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: O Arjuna, as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, I know everything that has happened in the past, all that is happening in the present, and all things that are yet to come. I also know all living entities, but Me no one knows.

slokas.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत । सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: O scion of Bhārata, O conqueror of the foe, all living entities are born into delusion, bewildered by dualities arisen from desire and hate.

slokas.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् । ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रता: ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: Persons who have acted piously in previous lives and in this life and whose sinful actions are completely eradicated are freed from the dualities of delusion, and they engage themselves in My service with determination.

slokas.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये । ते ब्रह्म तद्विदु: कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: Intelligent persons who are endeavoring for liberation from old age and death take refuge in Me in devotional service. They are actually Brahman because they entirely know everything about transcendental and fruitive activities.

slokas.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदु: । प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतस: ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: Those in full consciousness of Me, who know Me, the Supreme Lord, as the governing principle of the material manifestation, of the demigods, and of all methods of sacrifice, can understand and know Me, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, even at the time of death.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम । अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What is karma? What is the material manifestation, and what are the demigods?

slokas.sanskrit: अधियज्ञ: कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन । प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभि: ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: O Madhusūdana, how are You the Lord of sacrifice, and how are You to be known at the time of death by the self-controlled?

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते । भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्ग: कर्मसञ्ज्ञित: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: The indestructible, transcendental living entity is called Brahman, and his eternal nature is called the self. Action pertaining to the development of material bodies is called karma.

slokas.sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भाव: पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् । अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: O best of the embodied beings, the physical nature, which is constantly changing, is called adhibhūta; the universal form of the Lord, which includes all the demigods, is called adhidaiva; and I, the Supreme Lord, represented as the Supersoul in the heart of every embodied being, am called adhiyajña.

slokas.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् । य: प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशय: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: And whoever, at the end of his life, quits his body remembering Me alone at once attains My nature. Of this there is no doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् । तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावित: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: Whatever state of being one remembers when he quits his body, O son of Kuntī, that state he will attain without fail.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च । मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: Therefore, Arjuna, you should always think of Me in the form of Kṛṣṇa and at the same time carry out your prescribed duty of fighting. With your activities dedicated to Me and your mind and intelligence fixed on Me, you will attain Me without doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना । परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: He who meditates on the Supreme Personality of Godhead, his mind constantly engaged in remembering Me, undeviated from the path, he, O Pārtha, is sure to reach Me.

slokas.sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितार- मणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्य: । सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप- मादित्यवर्णं तमस: परस्तात् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: One should meditate upon the Supreme Person as the one who knows everything, as He who is the oldest, who is the controller, smaller than the smallest, the maintainer of everything, beyond all material conception, inconceivable, and always a person. He is luminous like the sun and, being transcendental, is beyond this material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव । भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: One who, at the time of death, with an unshaken mind, full of devotion, and by the power of yoga, fixes the prāṇa between the eyebrows and remembers the Supreme Lord in full devotion, will certainly attain to the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

slokas.sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागा: । यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: Persons who are learned in the Vedas, who utter oṁkāra, and who are great sages in the renounced order enter into Brahman. Desiring such perfection, one practices celibacy. Now I shall explain to you this process by which one may attain salvation.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च । मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मन: प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: The yogic situation is that of detachment from all sensual engagements. Closing all the doors of the senses and fixing the mind on the heart and the life air at the top of the head, one establishes himself in yoga.

slokas.sanskrit: ॐ इत्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् । य: प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: After being situated in this yoga practice and vibrating the sacred syllable oṁ, the supreme combination of letters, if one thinks of the Supreme Personality of Godhead and quits his body, he will certainly reach the spiritual planets.

slokas.sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः । तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: For one who remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O son of Pṛthā, because of his constant engagement in devotional service.

slokas.sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् । नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: After attaining Me, the great souls, who are yogīs in devotion, never return to this temporary world, which is full of miseries, because they have attained the highest perfection.

slokas.sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोका: पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन । मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of misery wherein repeated birth and death take place. But one who attains to My abode, O son of Kuntī, never takes birth again.

slokas.sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः । रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जना: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: By human calculation, a thousand ages taken together form the duration of Brahmā’s one day. And such also is the duration of his night.

slokas.sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तय: सर्वा: प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे । रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसञ्ज्ञके ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: At the beginning of Brahmā’s day, all living entities become manifest from the unmanifest state, and thereafter, when the night falls, they are merged into the unmanifest again.

slokas.sanskrit: भूतग्राम: स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते । रात्र्यागमेऽवश: पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: Again and again the day comes, and this host of beings is active; and again the night falls, O Pārtha, and they are helplessly dissolved.

slokas.sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातन: । य: स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Yet there is another unmanifest nature, which is eternal and is transcendental to this manifested and unmanifested matter. It is supreme and is never annihilated. When all in this world is annihilated, that part remains as it is.

slokas.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहु: परमां गतिम् । यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: That unmanifest realm is called the supreme destination. When one goes there, he never comes back. That is My supreme abode.

slokas.sanskrit: पुरुष: स पर: पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया । यस्यान्त:स्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is greater than all, is attainable by unalloyed devotion. Although He is present in His own abode, He is all-pervading, and everything is situated within Him.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिन: । प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, I shall now explain to you the different times at which, passing away from this world, the yogī does or does not come back.

slokas.sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरह: शुक्ल: षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् । तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जना: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who know the Supreme Brahman attain that Supreme by passing away from the world during the influence of the fiery god, in the light, at an auspicious moment of the day, during the fortnight of the waxing moon, or during the six months when the sun travels in the north.

slokas.sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्ण: षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् । तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: The mystic who passes away from this world during the smoke, the night, the fortnight of the waning moon, or the six months when the sun passes to the south, reaches the moon planet but again comes back.

slokas.sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगत: शाश्वते मते । एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुन: ॥ ২৬ ॥
slokas.translation: According to the Vedas, there are two ways of passing from this world—one in light and one in darkness. When one passes in light, he does not come back; but when one passes in darkness, he returns.

slokas.sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन । तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: Although the devotees know these two paths, O Arjuna, they are never bewildered. Therefore be always fixed in devotion.

slokas.sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तप:सु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् । अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: A person who accepts the path of devotional service is not bereft of the results derived from studying the Vedas, performing sacrifices, undergoing austerities, or giving charity. At the end he reaches the supreme eternal abode.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे । ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: My dear Arjuna, because you are never envious of Me, I shall impart to you this most confidential knowledge and realization, knowing which you shall be relieved of the miseries of material existence.

slokas.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् । प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: This knowledge is the king of education, the most secret of all secrets. It is the purest knowledge, and because it gives direct perception of the self by realization, it is the perfection of religion. It is everlasting, and it is joyfully performed.

slokas.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप । अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युंसंसारवर्त्मनि ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who are not faithful on the path of devotional service cannot attain Me, O conqueror of foes, but return to birth and death in this material world.

slokas.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना । मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: By Me, in My unmanifested form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.

slokas.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् । भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: And yet everything that is created does not rest in Me. Behold My mystic opulence! Although I am the maintainer of all living entities, and although I am everywhere, still My Self is the very source of creation.

slokas.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् । तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: Understand that as the mighty wind, blowing everywhere, rests always in the sky, all created beings rest in Me.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् । कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Kuntī, at the end of the millennium every material manifestation enters into My nature, and at the beginning of another millennium, by My potency, I again create.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुन: पुन: । भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: The whole cosmic order is under Me. By My will it is manifested again and again, and by My will it is annihilated at the end.

slokas.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय । उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: O Dhanañjaya, all this work cannot bind Me. I am ever detached, seated as though neutral.

slokas.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् । हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, O son of Kuntī, producing all moving and nonmoving beings. Under its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.

slokas.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् । परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: Fools deride Me when I descend in the human form. They do not know My transcendental nature and My supreme dominion over all that be.

slokas.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञानाविचेतसः । राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who are thus bewildered are attracted by demoniac and atheistic views. In that deluded condition, their hopes for liberation, their fruitive activities, and their culture of knowledge are all defeated.

slokas.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः । भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Pṛthā, those who are not deluded, the great souls, are under the protection of the divine nature. They are fully engaged in devotional service, because they know Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, original and inexhaustible.

slokas.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः । नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: Always chanting My glories, endeavoring with great determination, bowing down before Me, these great souls perpetually worship Me with devotion.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते । एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: Others, who engage in the cultivation of knowledge, worship the Supreme Lord as the one without a second, as diverse, and in the universal form.

slokas.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् । मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: But it is I who am the ritual, I the sacrifice, the offering to the ancestors, the healing herb, the transcendental chant. I am the butter and the fire and the offering.

slokas.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः । वेद्यं पवित्रम omकार ऋक् साम यजुरेव च ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support, and the grandsire. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, and the syllable om. I am also the Ṛg, the Sāma, and the Yajur Vedas.

slokas.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् । प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the most dear friend. I am the creation and the annihilation, the basis of everything, the resting place, and the eternal seed.

slokas.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च । अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: O Arjuna, I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality, and I am also death personified. Both being and nonbeing are in Me.

slokas.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपा: पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते । ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Those who study the Vedas and drink the soma juice, seeking the heavenly planets, worship Me indirectly. Purified of sinful reactions, they take birth on the pious heavenly planet of Indra, where they enjoy godly delights.

slokas.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति । एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: When they have thus enjoyed heavenly sense pleasure, they return to this mortal planet again. Thus, through the Vedic principles, they achieve only flickering happiness.

slokas.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जना: पर्युपासते । तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: But those who always worship Me with exclusive devotion, meditating on My transcendental form—to them I carry what they lack, and I preserve what they have.

slokas.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: । तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: Whatever a man may sacrifice to other gods, O son of Kuntī, is really meant for Me alone, but it is offered without true understanding.

slokas.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च । न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: I am the only enjoyer and master of all sacrifices. Therefore, those who do not recognize My true transcendental nature fall down.

slokas.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रता: । भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who worship the demigods will take birth among the demigods; those who worship ancestors go to the ancestors; those who worship ghosts and spirits will take birth among such beings; and those who worship Me will live with Me.

slokas.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति । तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water, I will accept it.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् । यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerities you perform—do that, O son of Kuntī, as an offering to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः । संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: In this way you will be freed from bondage to work and its auspicious and inauspicious results. With your mind fixed on Me in this principle of renunciation, you will be liberated and come to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः । ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: I envy no one, nor am I partial to anyone. I am equal to all. But whoever renders service unto Me in devotion is a friend, is in Me, and I am also a friend to him.

slokas.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् । साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: Even if one commits the most abominable action, if he is engaged in devotional service, he is to be considered saintly because he is properly situated.

slokas.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति । कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas.translation: He quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O son of Kuntī, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.

slokas.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्यु: पापयोनय: । स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Pṛthā, those who take shelter in Me, though they be of lower birth—women, vaiśyas, and śūdras—can attain the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणा: पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा । अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas.translation: How much greater, then, are the brāhmaṇas, the righteous, the devotees, and saintly kings who in this temporary, miserable world engage in loving service unto Me.

slokas.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु । मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas.translation: Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, worship Me, and offer your homage unto Me. Thus you will come to Me without fail. I promise you this because you are My very dear friend.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः । यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Listen again, O mighty-armed Arjuna. Because you are My dear friend, for your benefit I shall speak to you further, giving knowledge that is better than what I have already explained.

slokas.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः । अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: Neither the hosts of demigods nor the great sages know My origin, for in every respect I am the source of the demigods and sages.

slokas.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् । असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: He who knows Me as the unborn, as the beginningless, as the Supreme Lord of all worlds—he, undeluded among men, is freed from all sins.

slokas.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः । सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from doubt and delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses, control of the mind, happiness and distress, birth, death, fear, fearlessness—

slokas.sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः । भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: Nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame, infamy—all these various qualities of living beings are created by Me alone.

slokas.sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा । मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: The seven great sages and before them the four other great sages and the Manus, the progenitors of mankind, are born from My mind, and all the living beings populating the various planets descend from them.

slokas.sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः । सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: He who knows in truth this glory and power of Mine engages in unalloyed devotional service; of this there is no doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते । इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. Everything emanates from Me. The wise, who know this perfectly, engage in My devotional service and worship Me with all their hearts.

slokas.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् । कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: With their minds fixed on Me and their lives surrendered to Me, My devotees remain ever content in Me. They derive great satisfaction and bliss in enlightening one another about Me and in conversing about My glories.

slokas.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् । ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः । नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: To show them special mercy, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge the darkness born of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच परमं ब्रह्म परमं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् । पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate, the supreme abode and purifier, the Absolute Truth and the eternal divine person, the primal God, unborn and all-pervading.

slokas.sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा । असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: All the great sages such as Nārada, Asita, Devala, and Vyāsa proclaim this of You, and now You Yourself are declaring it to me.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव । न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: O Kṛṣṇa, I totally accept as truth all that You have told me. Neither the demigods nor the demons, O Lord, know Your personality.

slokas.sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम । भूतेषु देवदेवेश जगतः परमेश्वर ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: Indeed, You alone know Yourself by Your own internal potency, O Supreme Person, origin of all, Lord of all beings, God of gods, Lord of the universe!

slokas.sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः । याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: Please tell me in detail of Your divine opulences by which You pervade all these worlds.

slokas.sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिन्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् । केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: O Kṛṣṇa, O supreme mystic, how shall I constantly think of You, and in what various forms are You to be remembered by me?

slokas.sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन । भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: O Janārdana, again please describe in detail the mystic power of Your opulences. I am never satiated in hearing about You, for the more I hear, the more I want to taste the nectar of Your words.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः । प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Yes, I will tell you of My splendorous manifestations, but only of those which are prominent, O best of the Kurus, for My opulence is limitless.

slokas.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः । अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: I am the Self, O Gudākeśa, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

slokas.sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् । मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: Of the Ādityas I am Viṣṇu, of lights I am the radiant sun, of the Maruts I am Marīci, and among stars I am the moon.

slokas.sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः । इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: Of the Vedas I am the Sāma Veda; of the demigods I am Indra, the king of heaven; of the senses I am the mind; and in living beings I am the living force [consciousness].

slokas.sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् । वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: Of all the Rudras I am Lord Śiva; of the Yakṣas and Rākṣasas I am the lord of wealth, Kuvera; of the Vasus I am fire [Agni]; and of mountains I am Meru.

slokas.sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् । सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: Of priests, O Arjuna, know Me to be the chief, Bṛhaspati. Of generals I am Skanda, the lord of war; and of bodies of water I am the ocean.

slokas.sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् । यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: Of the great sages I am Bhṛgu; of vibrations I am the transcendental om; of sacrifices I am the chanting of the holy names [japa]; and of immovable things I am the Himalayas.

slokas.sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः । गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: Of all trees I am the holy fig tree; and among sages and demigods I am Nārada. Of the Gandharvas I am Citraratha, and among perfected beings I am the sage Kapila.

slokas.sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् । ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: Of horses know Me to be Uccaiḥśravā, produced during the churning of the ocean for nectar. Of lordly elephants I am Airāvata, and among men I am the monarch.

slokas.sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् । प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: Of weapons I am the thunderbolt; among cows I am the surabhi cow; of causes for procreation I am Kandarpa, the god of love; and of serpents I am Vāsuki.

slokas.sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् । पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: Of the many-hooded Nāgas I am Ananta; among aquatics I am Varuṇa; of departed ancestors I am Aryamā; and among dispensers of law I am Yama, the lord of death.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् । मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहम्वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: Among the Daityas I am the devoted Prahlāda; among subduers I am time; among beasts I am the lion; and among birds I am Garuḍa.

slokas.sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् । झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas.translation: Of purifiers I am the wind; of wielders of weapons I am Rāma; of fishes I am the shark; and of flowing rivers I am the Ganges.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन । अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas.translation: Of all creations I am the beginning and the end and also the middle, O Arjuna. Of all sciences I am the spiritual science of the self, and among logicians I am the conclusive truth.

slokas.sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च । अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas.translation: Of letters I am the letter A, and among compound words I am the dual. I am also inexhaustible time, and of creators I am Brahmā.

slokas.sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् । कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas.translation: I am all-devouring death, and I am the generating principle of all that is yet to be. Among women I am fame, fortune, fine speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and patience.

slokas.sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् । मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas.translation: Of hymns I am the Bṛhat-sāma sung to the Lord; of poetry I am the Gāyatrī. Of months I am Mārgaśīrṣa (November–December), and of seasons I am flower-bearing spring.

slokas.sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् । जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas.translation: I am also the gambling of cheats, and of the splendid I am the splendor. I am victory, I am adventure, and I am the strength of the strong.

slokas.sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः । मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas.translation: Of the descendants of Vṛṣṇi I am Vāsudeva; of the Pāṇḍavas I am Arjuna; of the sages I am Vyāsa; and among great thinkers I am Uśanā.

slokas.sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् । मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas.translation: Among punishments I am the rod of chastisement; among those who seek victory I am morality; of secrets I am silence; and of the wise I am wisdom.

slokas.sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन । न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas.translation: Furthermore, O Arjuna, I am the generating seed of all existences. There is no being—moving or nonmoving—that can exist without Me.

slokas.sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप । एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥ ४० ॥
slokas.translation: O conqueror of the enemy, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken to you is but a mere indication of My infinite opulences.

slokas.sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा । तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम् ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas.translation: Know that all opulent, beautiful, and glorious creations spring from but a spark of My splendor.

slokas.sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन । विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas.translation: But what need is there, Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself I pervade and support this entire universe.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् । यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: By my hearing the instructions You have kindly given me about these most confidential spiritual subjects, my illusion has now been dispelled.

slokas.sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया । त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: O lotus-eyed one, I have heard from You in detail about the appearance and disappearance of every living entity, as realized through Your inexhaustible glories.

slokas.sanskrit: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर । द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: O greatest of all personalities, O supreme form, though I see here before me Your actual position, I yet wish to see how You have entered into this cosmic manifestation. I want to see that form of Yours.

slokas.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो । योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: If You think that I am able to behold Your cosmic form, O my Lord, O master of all mystic power, then kindly show me that unlimited universal Self.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: My dear Arjuna, O son of Pṛthā, behold now My opulences—hundreds of thousands of varied divine and multicolored forms.

slokas.sanskrit: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा । बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, see here the different manifestations of Ādityas, Vasus, Rudras, Aśvinī-kumāras, and all the other demigods. Behold the many wonderful things which no one has ever seen or heard of before.

slokas.sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् । मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: O Arjuna, whatever you wish to see, behold at once in this body! This universal form can show you whatever you now desire to see and whatever you may want to see in the future. Everything—moving and nonmoving—is here completely, in one place.

slokas.sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा । दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: But you cannot see Me with your present eyes. Therefore I give you divine eyes. Behold My mystic opulence!

slokas.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः । दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: Sañjaya said: O King, having spoken thus, the Supreme Lord of all mystic power, the Personality of Godhead, displayed His universal form to Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् । अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna saw in that universal form unlimited mouths and unlimited eyes. It was all wondrous. The form was decorated with many celestial ornaments and bore many divine upraised weapons.

slokas.sanskrit: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् । सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: He wore celestial garlands and garments, and many divine scents were smeared over His body. All was wondrous, brilliant, unlimited, all-expanding.

slokas.sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता । यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: If hundreds of thousands of suns were to rise at once into the sky, their radiance might resemble the effulgence of the Supreme Person in that universal form.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा । अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: At that time Arjuna could see in the universal form of the Lord the unlimited expansions of the universe situated in one place, although divided into many thousands.

slokas.sanskrit: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः । प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: Then, bewildered and astonished, his hair standing on end, Arjuna bowed his head to offer obeisances and with folded hands began to pray to the Supreme Lord.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् । ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ- मृषीश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: My dear Lord Kṛṣṇa, I see assembled in Your body all the demigods and various other living entities. I see Brahmā, seated on the lotus flower, as well as Lord Śiva and all the sages and divine serpents.

slokas.sanskrit: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् । नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: O Lord of the universe, O universal form, I see You everywhere, with unlimited arms, bellies, mouths, and eyes. You are expanded everywhere, without limit. There is no end, there is no middle, and there is no beginning to You.

slokas.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् । पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: Your form is difficult to see because of its glaring effulgence, which is spreading on all sides, like blazing fire or the immeasurable radiance of the sun. Yet I see this glowing form everywhere, adorned with various crowns, clubs, and discs.

slokas.sanskrit: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् । त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: You are the supreme primal objective. You are the ultimate resting place of all this universe. You are inexhaustible, and You are the oldest. You are the maintainer of the eternal religion, the Personality of Godhead. This is my opinion.

slokas.sanskrit: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य- मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् । पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: You are without origin, middle, or end. Your glory is unlimited. You have numberless arms, and the sun and moon are among Your great, unlimited eyes. By Your own radiance You are heating this entire universe.

slokas.sanskrit: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः । दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Although You are one, You are spread throughout the sky and the planets and all space between. O great one, as I behold this terrible form, I see that all planetary systems are perplexed.

slokas.sanskrit: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति । स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: All the demigods are surrendering and entering into You. They are very much afraid, and with folded hands they are singing the Vedic hymns. The great sages and perfected beings, crying 'All peace!' are praying to You by singing the Vedic mantras.

slokas.sanskrit: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च । गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: All the various groups of demigods and demons are surrendering before You. The Siddhas, the Gandharvas, the Yakṣas, the Asuras, and all perfected demigods are gazing at You in amazement.

slokas.sanskrit: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् । बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: O mighty-armed one, all the planets with their demigods are disturbed at seeing Your great form with its many faces, eyes, arms, thighs, legs, and bellies and Your many terrible teeth. And as they are disturbed, so am I.

slokas.sanskrit: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् । दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: O all-pervading Viṣṇu, seeing You with Your many radiant colors touching the sky, Your gaping mouths, and Your great glowing eyes, my mind is perturbed by fear. I can no longer maintain my steadiness or equilibrium of mind.

slokas.sanskrit: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि । दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: O Lord of lords, O refuge of the worlds, please be gracious to me. I cannot keep my balance seeing thus Your blazing deathlike faces and awful teeth. In all directions I am bewildered.

slokas.sanskrit: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घैः । भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: All the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra, along with their allied kings, and Bhīṣma, Droṇa, Karṇa—and our chief soldiers also—are rushing into Your fearful mouths. And some I see trapped with heads smashed between Your teeth.

slokas.sanskrit: वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि । केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु संदृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: I see all people rushing with full speed into Your mouths, as moths dash to destruction in a blazing fire. Some are seen caught between Your teeth, their heads being crushed.

slokas.sanskrit: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति । तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: As the many waves of the rivers flow into the ocean, so do all these great warriors enter blazing into Your mouths.

slokas.sanskrit: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः । तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: I see all people rushing into Your mouths quickly, as moths dash with great speed into a blazing fire.

slokas.sanskrit: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः । तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: O Viṣṇu, I see You devouring all people from all sides with Your flaming mouths. Covering all the universe with Your effulgence, You are manifest with terrible, scorching rays.

slokas.sanskrit: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद । विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas.translation: O Lord of lords, so fierce of form, please tell me who You are. I offer my obeisances unto You; please be gracious to me. You are the primal Lord. I want to know about You, for I do not know what Your mission is.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः । ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Time I am, destroyer of the worlds, and I have come to engage all people. With the exception of you [the Pāṇḍavas], all the soldiers here on both sides will be slain.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून् भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् । मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas.translation: Therefore get up and prepare to fight and win glory. Conquer your enemies and enjoy a flourishing kingdom. They are already put to death by My arrangement, and you, O Savyasācin, can be but an instrument in the fight.

slokas.sanskrit: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् । मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas.translation: Droṇa, Bhīṣma, Jayadratha, Karṇa, and the other great warriors have already been destroyed by Me. Therefore kill them and do not be disturbed. Simply fight, and you will vanquish your enemies in battle.

slokas.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी । नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas.translation: Sañjaya said: Hearing these words of Keśava, Arjuna trembled, and with folded hands he offered obeisances again and again. He addressed Kṛṣṇa, faltering, overwhelmed with fear.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च । रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O master of the senses, the world becomes joyful upon hearing Your name, and thus everyone becomes attached to You. Although the perfected beings offer You their respectful homage, the demons are afraid, and they flee here and there. All this is rightly done.

slokas.sanskrit: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे । अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत् ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas.translation: O great one, greater even than Brahmā, You are the original creator. Why should they not offer their respects unto You? O limitless one, O God of gods, O refuge of the universe! You are the invincible source, the cause of all causes, transcendental to this material manifestation.

slokas.sanskrit: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् । वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas.translation: You are the original Personality, the Godhead. You are the only sanctuary of this manifested cosmic world. You know everything, and You are all that is knowable. You are the supreme refuge above the material modes. O limitless form! This whole cosmic manifestation is pervaded by You!

slokas.sanskrit: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च । नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas.translation: You are air, fire, water, and the moon. You are Brahmā, and the great-grandfather. I offer my respectful obeisances unto You a thousand times, and again and yet again!

slokas.sanskrit: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व । अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः ॥ ४० ॥
slokas.translation: O Lord, from the front, from behind, and from all sides I offer my obeisances unto You. You are the unlimited strength, the master of all power. You are all-pervading, and thus You are everything.

slokas.sanskrit: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति । अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas.translation: Thinking of You as my friend, I have rashly addressed You 'O Kṛṣṇa,' 'O Yādava,' 'O my friend,' not knowing Your glories. Please forgive me whatever I may have done in madness or in love.

slokas.sanskrit: यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु । एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas.translation: Whatever I have disrespectfully said to You in jest, during relaxation, while lying on the same bed, or sitting or eating together—alone or in front of others—please excuse me, O infallible one.

slokas.sanskrit: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् । न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas.translation: You are the father of this complete cosmic manifestation, the worshipable chief, the spiritual master. No one is equal to You, nor can anyone be one with You. How then could there be anyone greater than You within the three worlds, O Lord of immeasurable power?

slokas.sanskrit: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् । पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas.translation: You are the Supreme Lord, to be worshiped by every living being. Thus I fall down to offer You my respects and ask Your mercy. As a father tolerates the impudence of his son, a friend the impertinence of his friend, or a lover the familiarity of his beloved, please tolerate the wrongs I may have done You.

slokas.sanskrit: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे । तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas.translation: After seeing this universal form, which I have never seen before, I am gladdened, but at the same time my mind is disturbed with fear. Therefore please bestow Your grace upon me and again show me Your form as the Personality of Godhead, O Lord of lords, O abode of the universe.

slokas.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्त- मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव । तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas.translation: I wish to see You in Your four-armed form, with helmeted head and with club, wheel, conch, and lotus flower in Your hands. I long to see You in that form.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् । तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ॥ ४७ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: My dear Arjuna, happily I have shown you this universal form within the material world by My internal potency. No one before you has ever seen this unlimited, glaring, effulgent form of Mine.

slokas.sanskrit: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः । एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके दृष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ॥ ४८ ॥
slokas.translation: O best of the Kurus, no one before you has ever seen this universal form of Mine. For neither by studying the Vedas, nor by performing sacrifices, nor by charity, nor by pious activities, nor by severe penances can I be seen in this form in the material world.

slokas.sanskrit: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् । व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमना: पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ॥ ४९ ॥
slokas.translation: You have been perturbed and bewildered by seeing this horrible feature of Mine. Now let it be finished. My devotee, be free from all disturbance. With a peaceful mind you can now see the form you desire.

slokas.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः । आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ॥ ५० ॥
slokas.translation: Sañjaya said to Dhṛtarāṣṭra: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, Kṛṣṇa, while speaking thus to Arjuna, displayed His real four-armed form, and at last He again showed His two-armed form, thus encouraging the fearful Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन । इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः ॥ ५१ ॥
slokas.translation: When Arjuna thus saw Kṛṣṇa in His original form, he said: O Janārdana, seeing this humanlike form, so very beautiful, I am now composed in mind, and I am restored to my normal nature.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम । देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ॥ ५२ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: My dear Arjuna, this form of Mine you are now seeing is very difficult to behold. Even the demigods are ever seeking the opportunity to see this form, which is so dear.

slokas.sanskrit: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया । शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ॥ ५३ ॥
slokas.translation: The form you are seeing with your transcendental eyes cannot be understood simply by studying the Vedas, nor by undergoing serious penances, nor by charity, nor by worship. It is not by these means that one can see Me as I am.

slokas.sanskrit: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन । ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ॥ ५४ ॥
slokas.translation: My dear Arjuna, only by undivided devotional service can I be understood as I am, standing before you, and can thus be seen directly. Only in this way can you enter into the mysteries of My understanding.

slokas.sanskrit: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः । निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव ॥ ५५ ॥
slokas.translation: My dear Arjuna, he who engages in My pure devotional service, free from the contamination of previous activities and from mental speculation, he who works for Me, makes Me the supreme goal of his life, and is friendly to every living being—he certainly comes to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते । ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna inquired: Which are considered to be more perfect, those who are properly engaged in Your devotional service, or those who worship the impersonal Brahman, the unmanifested?

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते । श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Those who fix their minds on My personal form and are always engaged in worshiping Me with great faith are considered by Me to be most perfect.

slokas.sanskrit: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते । सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम् ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: But those who fully worship the unmanifested, that which lies beyond the perception of the senses, the all-pervading, inconceivable, unchanging, fixed and immovable—the impersonal conception of the Absolute Truth—

slokas.sanskrit: सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः । ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: Controlling the various senses and being equally disposed toward everyone, such persons, engaged in the welfare of all, at last achieve Me.

slokas.sanskrit: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् । अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifested, impersonal feature of the Supreme, advancement is very troublesome. To make progress in that discipline is always difficult for those who are embodied.

slokas.sanskrit: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः । अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: But those who worship Me, giving up all their activities unto Me and being devoted to Me without deviation, engaged in devotional service and always meditating upon Me, having fixed their minds upon Me, O son of Pṛthā—for them I am the swift deliverer from the ocean of birth and death.

slokas.sanskrit: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युंसंसारसागरात् । भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: For them, whose minds are fixed on Me, O Arjuna, I am the swift deliverer from the ocean of birth and death.

slokas.sanskrit: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय । निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: Just fix your mind upon Me, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, and engage all your intelligence in Me. Thus you will live in Me always, without a doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शकेषि मयि स्थिरम् । अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: My dear Arjuna, if you cannot fix your mind upon Me without deviation, then follow the regulative principles of bhakti-yoga. In this way you will develop a desire to attain to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव । मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: If you cannot practice the regulations of bhakti-yoga, then just try to work for Me, for by working for Me you will come to the perfect stage.

slokas.sanskrit: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः । सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान् ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: If you cannot take to this practice, then engage yourself in the cultivation of knowledge. Better than knowledge, however, is meditation, and better than meditation is renunciation of the fruits of action, for by such renunciation one can attain peace of mind.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते । ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: Better than mechanical practice is knowledge; better than knowledge is meditation; better than meditation is renunciation of the results of work. By such renunciation, one can attain peace.

slokas.sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च । निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is not envious but who is a kind friend to all living entities, who does not think himself a proprietor, who is free from false ego, who is equal in both happiness and distress, who is tolerant—

slokas.sanskrit: सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः । मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: —who is always satisfied and engaged in devotional service with determination, whose mind and intelligence are fixed on Me—such a devotee of Mine is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: यसमान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः । हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is not disturbed by anyone and who does not disturb anyone, who is steady in happiness and distress, who is free from fear and anxiety—such a devotee is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः । सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: My devotee who is not dependent on the ordinary course of activities, who is pure, expert, without cares, free from all pains, and who does not strive for some result, is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति । शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: One who neither rejoices nor hates, who neither laments nor desires, and who renounces both auspicious and inauspicious things—such a devotee is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः । शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is equal to friends and enemies, who is equipoised in honor and dishonor, heat and cold, happiness and distress, fame and infamy, who is always free from contaminating association, always silent and satisfied with anything, who doesn’t care for any residence, who is fixed in knowledge and engaged in devotional service—such a person is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् । अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: A devotee who is not envious, who is a kind friend to all living entities, who is free from attachment to material possessions, who is self-controlled, equipoised, satisfied in all conditions, and engaged in devotional service with determination—such a devotee is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते । श्रद्धधानाः मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Those who follow this imperishable path of devotional service and who completely engage themselves with faith, making Me the supreme goal, are most dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च । एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O my dear Kṛṣṇa, I wish to know about prakṛti [nature], puruṣa [the enjoyer], and the field and the knower of the field, and of knowledge and the object of knowledge. Please explain all these to me.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते । एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: This body, O son of Kuntī, is called the field, and one who knows this body is called the knower of the field by those who are learned.

slokas.sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत । क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: O scion of Bharata, you should understand that I am also the knower in all bodies, and to understand this body and its knower is called knowledge. That is My opinion.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् । स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: Now please hear My brief description of this field of activity and how it is constituted, what its changes are, whence it is produced, who that knower of the field of activities is, and what his influences are.

slokas.sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् । ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: That knowledge of the field of activities and of the knower of activities is described by various sages in various Vedic writings—it is especially presented in Vedānta-sūtra, with all reasoning as to cause and effect.

slokas.sanskrit: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च । इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: The five great elements, false ego, intelligence, the unmanifested, the ten senses, the mind, and the five sense objects—

slokas.sanskrit: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः । एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: —desire, hatred, happiness, distress, the aggregate, the life symptoms, and convictions—all these are considered, in summary, to be the field of activities and its interactions.

slokas.sanskrit: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् । आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: Humility, pridelessness, nonviolence, tolerance, simplicity, approaching a bona fide spiritual master, cleanliness, steadiness, and self-control—

slokas.sanskrit: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च । जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: —renunciation of the objects of sense gratification, absence of false ego, the perception of the evil of birth, death, old age, and disease—

slokas.sanskrit: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु । नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: —detachment, freedom from entanglement with children, wife, home and the rest, and even-mindedness amid pleasant and unpleasant events—

slokas.sanskrit: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी । विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: —constant and unalloyed devotion to Me, resorting to solitary places, detachment from the general mass of people—

slokas.sanskrit: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् । एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: —accepting the importance of self-realization, and philosophical search for the Absolute Truth—all these I declare to be knowledge, and besides this whatever there may be is ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वाऽमृतमश्नुते । अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: I shall now explain the knowable, knowing which you will taste the eternal. This beginningless Brahman, who lies beyond cause and effect, is imperishable.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् । सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: Everywhere are His hands and legs, His eyes, heads and faces, and He has ears everywhere. In this way the Supersoul exists, pervading everything.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् । असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: The Supersoul is the original source of all senses, yet He is without senses. He is unattached, although He is the maintainer of all living beings. He transcends the modes of nature, and at the same time He is the master of all the modes of material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च । सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: The Supersoul is the original source of all senses, yet He is without senses. Although He is unattached, He is the maintainer of all living beings. He transcends the modes of nature, yet at the same time He is the master of all modes of material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् । भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: Although the Supersoul appears to be divided among all beings, He is never divided. He is situated as one. Although He is the maintainer of every living entity, it is to be understood that He devours and develops all.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते । ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: He is the source of light in all luminous objects. He is beyond the darkness of matter and is unmanifested. He is knowledge, He is the object of knowledge, and He is the goal of knowledge. He is situated in everyone’s heart.

slokas.sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः । मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: Thus the field of activities [the body], knowledge, and the knowable have been summarily described by Me. Only My devotees can understand this thoroughly and thus attain to My nature.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनाद्यौभवापि । विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Material nature and the living entities should be understood to be beginningless. Their transformations and the modes of matter are products of material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते । पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: Nature is said to be the cause of all material causes and effects, whereas the living entity is the cause of the various sufferings and enjoyments in this world.

slokas.sanskrit: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् । कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: The living entity in material nature thus follows the ways of life, enjoying the three modes of nature. This is due to his association with that material nature. Thus he meets with good and evil among various species.

slokas.sanskrit: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः । परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: Yet in this body there is another, a transcendental enjoyer, who is the Lord, the supreme proprietor, who exists as the overseer and permitter, and who is known as the Supersoul.

slokas.sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह । सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: One who understands this philosophy concerning material nature, the living entity, and the interaction of the modes of nature is sure to attain liberation. He will not take birth here again, regardless of his present position.

slokas.sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना । अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: Some perceive the Supersoul within themselves through meditation, others through the cultivation of knowledge, and still others through working without fruitive desires.

slokas.sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते । तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: Again there are those who, although not conversant in spiritual knowledge, begin to worship the Supreme Person upon hearing about Him from others. Because of their tendency to hear from authorities, they also transcend the path of birth and death.

slokas.sanskrit: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् । क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥ २७ ॥
