slokas.translation: O chief of the Bhāratas, whatever you see in existence, whether moving or nonmoving, is only the combination of the field of activities and the knower of the field.

slokas.sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् । विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: One who sees the Supersoul accompanying the individual soul in all bodies, and who understands that neither the soul nor the Supersoul within the destructible body is ever destroyed, actually sees.

slokas.sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् । न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: One who sees the Supersoul equally present everywhere, in every living being, does not degrade himself by his mind. Thus he approaches the transcendental destination.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः । यः पश्यति तथाऽत्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: One who can see that all activities are performed by the body, which is created of material nature, and sees that the self does nothing, actually sees.

slokas.sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति । तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas.translation: When a sensible man ceases to see different identities due to different material bodies, and he sees how beings are expanded everywhere, he attains to the Brahman conception.

slokas.sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः । शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas.translation: Those with the vision of eternity can see that the imperishable soul is transcendental, eternal, and beyond the modes of nature. O Arjuna, although dwelling in the body, such a soul neither acts, nor is entangled.

slokas.sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते । सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas.translation: The sky, due to its subtle nature, does not mix with anything, although it is all-pervading. Similarly, the soul, situated in the consciousness pervading the body, does not mix with the body.

slokas.sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः । क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Bharata, as the sun alone illuminates all this universe, so does the living entity, one within the body, illuminate the entire body by consciousness.

slokas.sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा । भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who see with the eyes of knowledge the difference between the body and the knower of the body, and can also understand the process of liberation from bondage in material nature, attain to the supreme goal.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् । यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Again I shall declare to you this supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all the sages have attained the supreme perfection.

slokas.sanskrit: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः । सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: By becoming fixed in this knowledge, one can attain to the transcendental nature, which is like My own nature. Thus established, one is not born at the time of creation nor disturbed at the time of dissolution.

slokas.sanskrit: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् । सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: The total material substance, called Brahman, is the source of birth, and it is that Brahman that I impregnate, making possible the births of all living beings, O son of Bharata.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः । तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: It should be understood that all species of life, O son of Kuntī, are made possible by birth in this material nature, and that I am the seed-giving father.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः । निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: Material nature consists of three modes—goodness, passion, and ignorance. When the eternal living entity comes in contact with nature, O mighty-armed Arjuna, he becomes conditioned by these modes.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् । सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: O sinless one, the mode of goodness, being purer than the others, is illuminating, and it frees one from all sinful reactions. Those situated in that mode become conditioned by a sense of happiness and knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् । तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: The mode of passion is born of unlimited desires and longings, O son of Kuntī, and because of this the embodied living entity is bound to material fruitive actions.

slokas.sanskrit: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् । प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Bharata, the mode of darkness, born of ignorance, is the delusion of all embodied living entities. The results of this mode are madness, indolence, and sleep, which bind the conditioned soul.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत । ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: The mode of goodness conditions one to happiness, passion conditions one to fruitive action, and ignorance, covering one’s knowledge, binds one to madness.

slokas.sanskrit: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत । रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: Sometimes the mode of goodness becomes prominent, defeating the modes of passion and ignorance, O son of Bharata. Sometimes passion defeats goodness and ignorance, and at other times ignorance defeats goodness and passion. In this way there is always competition for supremacy.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते । ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: The manifestations of the mode of goodness can be experienced when all the gates of the body are illuminated by knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा । रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: O chief of the Bhāratas, when there is an increase in the mode of passion, the symptoms of great attachment, fruitive activity, intense endeavor, and uncontrollable desire and hankering develop.

slokas.sanskrit: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च । तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: When there is an increase in the mode of ignorance, O son of Kuru, darkness, inertia, madness, and illusion are manifested.

slokas.sanskrit: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् । तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: When one dies in the mode of goodness, he attains to the pure higher planets of the great sages.

slokas.sanskrit: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते । तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: When one dies in the mode of passion, he takes birth among those engaged in fruitive activities; and when one dies in the mode of ignorance, he takes birth in the animal kingdom.

slokas.sanskrit: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् । रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: By acting in the mode of goodness, one becomes purified. Work done in the mode of passion results in misery, and work done in the mode of ignorance results in foolishness.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च । प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: From the mode of goodness, real knowledge develops; from the mode of passion, greed develops; and from the mode of ignorance arise madness, illusion, and darkness.

slokas.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः । जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: Those situated in the mode of goodness gradually go upward to the higher planets; those in the mode of passion live on the earthly planets; and those in the abominable mode of ignorance go down to the hellish worlds.

slokas.sanskrit: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति । गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: When you see that there is nothing beyond these modes of nature in all activities and that the Supreme Lord is transcendental to all these modes, then you can know My spiritual nature.

slokas.sanskrit: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् । जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: When the embodied being is able to transcend these three modes, he can become free from birth, death, old age, and their distresses and can enjoy nectar even in this life.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो । किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna inquired: O my Lord, by what symptoms is one known who is transcendental to these three modes? What is his behavior, and how does he transcend the modes of nature?

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव । न द्वेष्ट्यनुप्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: He who does not hate illumination, attachment, and delusion when they are present or long for them when they disappear—

slokas.sanskrit: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते । गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: He who is unwavering and undisturbed through all these reactions of the material qualities, remaining neutral and transcendental, knowing that the modes alone are active—he never falls down.

slokas.sanskrit: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः । तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: He who is situated in the self, who regards alike happiness and distress, who looks upon a lump of earth, a stone, and a piece of gold with an equal eye, who is equal toward the desirable and the undesirable, who is steady, situated equally well in praise and blame—

slokas.sanskrit: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः । सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: He who is equal in honor and dishonor, who treats alike both friend and enemy, and who has renounced all material activities—such a person is said to have transcended the modes of nature.

slokas.sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते । स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: One who engages in full devotional service, unfailing in all circumstances, at once transcends the modes of material nature and thus comes to the level of Brahman.

slokas.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च । शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: And I am the basis of the impersonal Brahman, which is immortal, imperishable, and eternal and is the constitutional position of ultimate happiness.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः । दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness; purification of one’s existence; cultivation of spiritual knowledge; charity; self-control; performance of sacrifice; study of the Vedas; austerity; and simplicity—these are the qualities by which the divine nature manifests.

slokas.sanskrit: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् । दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: Nonviolence, truthfulness, freedom from anger; renunciation; tranquility; aversion to faultfinding; compassion for all living entities; freedom from covetousness; gentleness; modesty; steady determination—these are the qualities of the divine nature.

slokas.sanskrit: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता । भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, freedom from envy, and the absence of pride—these, O scion of the Bhāratas, are the qualities of those endowed with the divine nature.

slokas.sanskrit: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च । अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: Arrogance, pride, anger, conceit, harshness, and ignorance—these qualities, O son of Pṛthā, belong to those of demoniac nature.

slokas.sanskrit: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता । मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: The transcendental qualities are conducive to liberation, whereas the demoniac qualities make for bondage. Do not worry, O son of Pāṇḍu, for you are born with the divine qualities.

slokas.sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च । दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Pṛthā, in this world there are two kinds of created beings. One is called the divine and the other demoniac. I have already explained to you at length the divine qualities. Now hear from Me of the demoniac.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः । न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who are demoniac do not know what is to be done and what is not to be done. Neither cleanliness nor proper behavior nor truth is found in them.

slokas.sanskrit: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् । अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: They say that this world is unreal, with no foundation, no God in control. It is produced of sex desire, and has no cause other than lust.

slokas.sanskrit: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः । प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: Following such conclusions, the demoniac, who are lost to themselves and who have no intelligence, engage in unbeneficial, horrible works meant to destroy the world.

slokas.sanskrit: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः । मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: Taking shelter of insatiable lust and absorbed in the conceit of pride and false prestige, the demoniac, thus illusioned, are always sworn to unclean work, attracted by the impermanent.

slokas.sanskrit: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः । कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: They believe that to gratify the senses is the prime necessity of human civilization. Thus until the end of life their anxiety is immeasurable. Bound by a network of hundreds of thousands of desires, by lust and anger, they secure money by illegal means for sense gratification.

slokas.sanskrit: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः । ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: Bound by hundreds and thousands of desires, and absorbed in lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by illegal means for sense gratification.

slokas.sanskrit: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् । इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: The demoniac person thinks: So much wealth do I have today, and I will gain more according to my schemes. So much is mine now, and it will increase in the future, more and more.

slokas.sanskrit: असौ मया हतः शत्रुरन्येषामपि मे हनिः । ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: He is my enemy, and I have killed him, and my other enemies will also be killed. I am the lord of everything, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, powerful, and happy.

slokas.sanskrit: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया । यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: The demoniac person thinks: I am wealthy and surrounded by aristocratic family members. I am the greatest of all. I shall perform sacrifices, I shall give some charity, and thus I shall rejoice. In this way such persons are deluded by ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः । प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: Thus perplexed by various anxieties and bound by a network of illusions, they become too strongly attached to sense enjoyment and fall down into hell.

slokas.sanskrit: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः । यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: Self-complacent and always impudent, deluded by wealth and false prestige, they sometimes proudly perform sacrifices in name only, without following any rules or regulations.

slokas.sanskrit: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः । मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: Bewildered by false ego, strength, pride, lust, and anger, the demoniac become envious of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is situated in their own bodies and in the bodies of others, and blaspheme against the real religion.

slokas.sanskrit: तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् । क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who are envious and mischievous, who are the lowest among men, I perpetually cast into the ocean of material existence, into various demoniac species of life.

slokas.sanskrit: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि । मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: Attaining repeated birth amongst the species of demoniac life, such persons can never approach Me. Gradually they sink down to the most abominable type of existence.

slokas.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः । कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: There are three gates leading to this hell—lust, anger, and greed. Every sane man should give these up, for they lead to the degradation of the soul.

slokas.sanskrit: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः । आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: The man who has escaped these three gates of hell, O son of Kuntī, performs acts conducive to self-realization and thus gradually attains the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः । न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: He who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own whims attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ । ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: One should understand what is duty and what is not duty by the regulations of the scriptures. Knowing such rules and regulations, one should act so that he may gradually be elevated.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच । ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः । तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, what is the position of those who give up the scriptural regulations but worship with faith? Is it in goodness, passion, or ignorance?

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा । सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: According to one’s embodied nature, faith is of three kinds — in goodness, passion, and ignorance. Now hear about these.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत । श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: O Bhārata, the faith of each is in accordance with his nature. The person is made of faith; whatever his faith is, that he is.

slokas.sanskrit: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः । प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: Men in the mode of goodness worship the demigods; those in passion worship demons and spirits; those in ignorance worship ghosts and spirits of the dead.

slokas.sanskrit: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः । दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: Those who practice severe austerities not recommended in the scriptures, performed out of pride and ego, driven by desire and attachment...

slokas.sanskrit: कर्शयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः । मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: ...they torture the elements in their bodies as well as Me who dwells within. Know them to be demoniac in determination.

slokas.sanskrit: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः । यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: Even food preferred by men is of three kinds, according to the modes. So are sacrifice, austerity, and charity. Hear of their distinctions.

slokas.sanskrit: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः । रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्याः आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: Foods that increase life, purity, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction—juicy, fatty, wholesome, and pleasing—are dear to the sāttvic.

slokas.sanskrit: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः । आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: Foods that are too bitter, sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry, and burning are dear to the rajasic, and cause pain, distress, and disease.

slokas.sanskrit: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् । उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: Food that is tasteless, decomposed, putrid, stale, refuse, and impure is dear to the tāmasic.

slokas.sanskrit: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते । यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: Sacrifice performed as a duty, without expectation of reward, in accordance with scriptural injunctions, is of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: अभिसंधाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् । इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: But sacrifice performed for material benefit, or with pride, know it to be rajasic, O best of the Bhāratas.

slokas.sanskrit: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् । श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: Sacrifice performed without following scripture, without food distribution, without mantras, without faith, is declared to be tāmasic.

slokas.sanskrit: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् । ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: Worship of the gods, the twice-born, the teachers, and the wise; purity, straightforwardness, celibacy, and nonviolence—these are austerities of the body.

slokas.sanskrit: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् । स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: Speech that is truthful, pleasing, beneficial, and not agitating, along with regular recitation of scripture—these are austerities of speech.

slokas.sanskrit: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः । भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: Serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of heart—these are austerities of the mind.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः । अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: This threefold austerity performed with supreme faith, by those desiring no fruit, is considered sāttvic.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् । क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: Austerity performed with hypocrisy, for honor, respect, and reverence, is declared rajasic, unstable, and impermanent.

slokas.sanskrit: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः । परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत् तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: Austerity performed with foolish stubbornness, with self-torture or for harming others, is declared tāmasic.

slokas.sanskrit: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे । देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: That gift given at the proper place and time, to a worthy person, without expectation of return, is considered sāttvic.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः । दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: But charity given with expectation of return, or with reluctance, is declared rajasic.

slokas.sanskrit: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते । असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत् तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: Charity given at the wrong place or time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with contempt, is declared tāmasic.

slokas.sanskrit: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः । ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: ‘Om Tat Sat’—these three words represent Brahman. From the beginning they were used to designate the Supreme, and so the brāhmaṇas chanted them in sacrifices and Vedic hymns.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः । प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: Therefore, uttering ‘Om’, acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity prescribed by the scriptures are always begun by those who understand the Absolute Truth.

slokas.sanskrit: तदित्यनभिसंधाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः । दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: Without desiring fruit, acts of sacrifice, austerity, and charity are performed with the word ‘Tat’, by those seeking liberation.

slokas.sanskrit: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते । प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: The word ‘Sat’ is used for existence and for goodness, and also for auspicious acts, O Pārtha.

slokas.sanskrit: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते । कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: Steadfastness in sacrifice, austerity, and charity is also called ‘Sat’; and action for the sake of the Supreme is also designated as ‘Sat’.

slokas.sanskrit: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् । असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: Whatever is offered, given, or performed, and whatever austerity is undertaken, without faith, it is called ‘Asat’—useless both here and hereafter.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् । त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन ॥ १ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: O mighty-armed Hṛṣīkeśa, O slayer of the Kesī demon, I wish to understand the purpose of renunciation (sannyāsa) and of renunciation of the fruits of action (tyāga), and the difference between them.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः । सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः ॥ २ ॥
slokas.translation: The Blessed Lord said: The giving up of activities that are based on material desire is what great learned men call the renounced order of life (sannyāsa). And giving up the results of all activities is what the wise call renunciation (tyāga).

slokas.sanskrit: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः । यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ॥ ३ ॥
slokas.translation: Some learned men declare that all kinds of fruitive activities should be given up as faulty, yet other sages maintain that acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be abandoned.

slokas.sanskrit: निश्चित्य मुनयो विप्र स्त्यागं प्राहुर्मनीषिणः । त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः सम्प्रकीर्तितः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, now hear My judgment about renunciation. O tiger among men, renunciation is declared in the scriptures to be of three kinds.

slokas.sanskrit: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् । यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas.translation: Acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance are not to be given up; they must be performed. Indeed, sacrifice, charity, and penance purify even the great souls.

slokas.sanskrit: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च । कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ॥ ६ ॥
slokas.translation: All these activities should be performed without attachment or any expectation of result. They should be performed as a matter of duty, O son of Pṛthā. That is My final opinion.

slokas.sanskrit: नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते । मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः ॥ ७ ॥
slokas.translation: Prescribed duties should never be renounced. If one renounces them out of illusion, that renunciation is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् । स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas.translation: If one gives up prescribed duties because they are troublesome or because of bodily discomfort, he is said to have renounced in the mode of passion, and he never gets the result of renunciation.

slokas.sanskrit: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन । सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas.translation: But when one performs his prescribed duty only because it ought to be done, and renounces all material association and all attachment to the fruit, his renunciation is said to be in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते । त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः ॥ १० ॥
slokas.translation: The intelligent renouncer situated in the mode of goodness neither hates inauspicious work nor is attached to auspicious work; he is free from all doubts about work.

slokas.sanskrit: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः । यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ॥ ११ ॥
slokas.translation: It is not possible for an embodied being to renounce all activities. But one who renounces the fruits of action is said to have truly renounced.

slokas.sanskrit: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् । भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas.translation: For one who has not renounced, the threefold results of action—desirable, undesirable, and mixed—accrue after death. But those who have renounced suffer no such results.

slokas.sanskrit: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे । सांख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas.translation: O mighty-armed Arjuna, according to the Vedānta, there are five causes for the accomplishment of all action. Now learn of these from Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् । विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ॥ १४ ॥
slokas.translation: The place of action, the performer, the various senses, the many different kinds of endeavor, and ultimately the Supersoul—these are the five factors of action.

slokas.sanskrit: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः । न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas.translation: Whatever right or wrong action a man performs by body, mind, or speech is caused by these five factors.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः । पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः ॥ १६ ॥
slokas.translation: Therefore one who thinks himself the only doer, not considering the five factors, is certainly not very intelligent and cannot see things as they are.

slokas.sanskrit: यस्य नाहंकृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते । हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is not motivated by false ego, whose intelligence is not entangled, though he kills men in this world, does not kill. Nor is he bound by his actions.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना । करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः ॥ १८ ॥
slokas.translation: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these are the three motivating factors for action. The senses, the work, and the doer are the threefold constituents of action.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः । प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ॥ १९ ॥
slokas.translation: According to the three modes of material nature, knowledge, action, and the doer are distinguished. Now hear of this as it is declared in the scriptures.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते । अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas.translation: That knowledge by which one sees the undivided spiritual nature in all beings, though divided among them, is to be understood as being in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् । वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas.translation: That knowledge by which one sees that in every different body there is a different type of living entity you should understand to be in the mode of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् । अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas.translation: But that knowledge by which one is attached to one kind of work as all in all, without knowledge of the truth, and which is meager, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् । अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते ॥ २३ ॥
slokas.translation: Action performed in terms of the directions of the scriptures, without attachment, without love or hatred, and without desire for fruitive results, is said to be in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः । क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas.translation: But action performed with great effort by one seeking to gratify his desires, and enacted from a sense of false ego, is called action in the mode of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् । मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते ॥ २५ ॥
slokas.translation: That action performed in illusion, in disregard of scriptural injunctions, and without concern for future bondage or for violence or distress caused to others is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः । सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas.translation: The worker who is free from all material attachments and false ego, who is enthusiastic and resolute, and who is equally disposed in success and failure is said to be a worker in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः । हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः ॥ २७ ॥
slokas.translation: The worker who is attached to the work and the fruits of work, desiring to enjoy them, who is greedy, envious, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow, is said to be in the mode of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः । विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ॥ २८ ॥
slokas.translation: The worker who is always engaged in work against the injunctions of the scripture, who is materialistic, obstinate, deceitful, expert in insulting others, lazy, morose, and procrastinating, is said to be a worker in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु । प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय ॥ २९ ॥
slokas.translation: Now, O winner of wealth, please listen as I tell you in detail of the three kinds of intelligence and determination, according to the modes of nature.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये । बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ॥ ३० ॥
slokas.translation: That understanding which knows what is to be done and what is not to be done, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating, is intelligence in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च । अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas.translation: That understanding which cannot distinguish between religion and irreligion, between what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, is intelligence in the mode of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसाऽऽवृता । सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas.translation: That understanding which, enveloped in darkness, imagines irreligion to be religion and sees things contrary to reality, is intelligence in the mode of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः । योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Pṛthā, that determination which is unbreakable, which is sustained with steadfastness by yoga practice, and which thus controls the mind, life, and senses, is determination in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन । प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas.translation: But that determination by which one holds fast to fruitive results in religion, economic development, and sense gratification is determination in the mode of passion, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च । न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas.translation: And that determination which cannot go beyond dreaming, fearfulness, lamentation, moroseness, and illusion—such unintelligent determination, O son of Pṛthā, is in the mode of darkness.

slokas.sanskrit: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ । अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas.translation: Now hear from Me about the three kinds of happiness by which the conditioned soul enjoys, and by which he sometimes comes to the end of all distress.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् । तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas.translation: That which in the beginning may be just like poison but at the end is like nectar, and which awakens one to self-realization, is said to be happiness in the mode of goodness.

slokas.sanskrit: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् । परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas.translation: That happiness which is derived from contact of the senses with their objects and which appears like nectar at first but poison at the end is said to be of the nature of passion.

slokas.sanskrit: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः । निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas.translation: And that happiness which is blind to self-realization, which is delusion from beginning to end, and which is arising from sleep, laziness, and illusion is said to be of the nature of ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः । सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः ॥ ४० ॥
slokas.translation: There is no being existing, either here or among the demigods in the higher planetary systems, which is freed from these three modes born of material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप । कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas.translation: Brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdras are distinguished by the qualities born of their own natures in accordance with the material modes, O chastiser of the enemy.

slokas.sanskrit: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च । ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas.translation: Peacefulness, self-control, austerity, purity, tolerance, honesty, knowledge, wisdom, and religiousness—these are the natural qualities by which the brāhmaṇas work.

slokas.sanskrit: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् । दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas.translation: Heroism, power, determination, resourcefulness, courage in battle, generosity, and leadership are the natural qualities of work for the kṣatriyas.

slokas.sanskrit: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् । परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas.translation: Farming, cow protection, and business are the natural work for the vaiśyas, and for the śūdras there is labor and service to others.

slokas.sanskrit: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः । स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas.translation: By following his qualities of work, every man can become perfect. Now hear from Me how this is done.

slokas.sanskrit: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् । स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas.translation: By worship of the Lord, who is the source of all beings and who is all-pervading, a man can attain perfection through performing his own work.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् । स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥ ४७ ॥
slokas.translation: It is better to engage in one’s own occupation, even though imperfectly, than to accept another’s occupation and perform it perfectly. Prescribed duties according to one’s nature are never affected by sinful reactions.

slokas.sanskrit: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् । सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः ॥ ४८ ॥
slokas.translation: Every endeavor is covered by some fault, just as fire is covered by smoke. Therefore one should not give up the work born of his nature, even if it is imperfect.

slokas.sanskrit: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः । नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति ॥ ४९ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is self-controlled and unattached and who disregards all material enjoyments can obtain, through renunciation, the highest perfectional stage of freedom from reaction.

slokas.sanskrit: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे । समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ॥ ५० ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Kuntī, learn from Me briefly how one who has attained perfection can achieve the supreme perfectional stage, Brahman, the stage of highest knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च । शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च ॥ ५१ ॥
slokas.translation: Being purified by his intelligence and controlling the mind with determination, giving up the objects of sense gratification, being freed from attachment and aversion—

slokas.sanskrit: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः । ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः ॥ ५२ ॥
slokas.translation: Living in a secluded place, eating little, controlling body, mind, and speech, always engaged in meditation, and cultivating detachment—

slokas.sanskrit: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् । विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥ ५३ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is free from false ego, strength, arrogance, desire, anger, and material possessions, and who is free from the notion of proprietorship, becomes peaceful and fit for self-realization.

slokas.sanskrit: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति । समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ॥ ५४ ॥
slokas.translation: One who is thus transcendentally situated at once realizes the Supreme Brahman. He never laments nor desires. He is equally disposed toward every living entity. In that state he achieves pure devotional service unto Me.

slokas.sanskrit: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः । ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ॥ ५५ ॥
slokas.translation: By devotion, one comes to know Me as I am, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Then, knowing Me in truth, he enters into full consciousness of Me.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः । मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ॥ ५६ ॥
slokas.translation: Though engaged in all kinds of activities, My pure devotee, under My protection, reaches the eternal and imperishable abode by My grace.

slokas.sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः । बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव ॥ ५७ ॥
slokas.translation: In all activities just depend upon Me and work always under My protection. In such devotional service, be fully conscious of Me.

slokas.sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि । अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि ॥ ५८ ॥
slokas.translation: If you become conscious of Me, you will pass over all obstacles of conditioned life by My grace. If, however, you do not work in such consciousness but act through false ego, not hearing Me, you will be lost.

slokas.sanskrit: यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे । मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ॥ ५९ ॥
slokas.translation: If you do not act according to My direction and do not fight, then you will be falsely directed. By your nature you will have to be engaged in warfare.

slokas.sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा । कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् ॥ ६० ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Kuntī, under illusion you are now declining to act according to My direction. But, compelled by your nature, you will act all the same, O son of Bharata.

slokas.sanskrit: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति । भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ॥ ६१ ॥
slokas.translation: The Supreme Lord is situated in everyone’s heart, O Arjuna, and is directing the wanderings of all living entities, who are seated as on a machine, made of the material energy.

slokas.sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत । तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ॥ ६२ ॥
slokas.translation: O scion of Bharata, surrender unto Him utterly. By His grace you will attain transcendental peace and the supreme eternal abode.

slokas.sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया । विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ॥ ६३ ॥
slokas.translation: Thus I have explained to you knowledge still more confidential. Deliberate on this fully, and then do what you wish to do.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः । इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ॥ ६४ ॥
slokas.translation: Because you are My very dear friend, I am speaking to you My supreme instruction, the most confidential knowledge of all. Hear this from Me, for it is for your benefit.

slokas.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु । मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ॥ ६५ ॥
slokas.translation: Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me, and offer your homage unto Me. Thus you will come to Me without fail. I promise you this because you are My very dear friend.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज । अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ॥ ६६ ॥
slokas.translation: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.

slokas.sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन । न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ॥ ६७ ॥
slokas.translation: This confidential knowledge may not be explained to those who are not austere, or devoted, or engaged in devotional service, nor to one who is envious of Me.

slokas.sanskrit: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति । भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः ॥ ६८ ॥
slokas.translation: For one who explains this supreme secret to the devotees, pure devotional service is guaranteed, and at the end he will come back to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः । भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ॥ ६९ ॥
slokas.translation: There is no servant in this world more dear to Me than he, nor will there ever be one more dear.

slokas.sanskrit: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः । ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ॥ ७० ॥
slokas.translation: And I declare that he who studies this sacred conversation of ours worships Me by his intelligence.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः । सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ॥ ७१ ॥
slokas.translation: And one who listens with faith and without envy becomes free from sinful reactions and attains to the auspicious planets where the pious dwell.

slokas.sanskrit: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा । कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय ॥ ७२ ॥
slokas.translation: O son of Pṛthā, have you heard this attentively with your mind focused? And are your ignorance and delusion now dispelled?

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत । स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव ॥ ७३ ॥
slokas.translation: Arjuna said: My dear Kṛṣṇa, O infallible one, my illusion is now gone. I have regained my memory by Your mercy. I am now firm and free from doubt and prepared to act according to Your instructions.

slokas.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः । संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ॥ ७४ ॥
slokas.translation: Sañjaya said: Thus have I heard the conversation of two great souls, Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna. And so wonderful is that message that my hair is standing on end.

slokas.sanskrit: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् । योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम् ॥ ७५ ॥
slokas.translation: By the mercy of Vyāsa, I have heard these most confidential talks directly from the master of all mysticism, Kṛṣṇa, who was speaking personally to Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् । केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः ॥ ७६ ॥
slokas.translation: O King, as I repeatedly recall this wondrous and holy dialogue between Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.

slokas.sanskrit: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः । विस्मयो मे महान्राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः ॥ ७७ ॥
slokas.translation: And remembering the astonishing form of Lord Hari, great is my wonder, and I rejoice again and again.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः । तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ॥ ७८ ॥
slokas.translation: Wherever there is Kṛṣṇa, the master of yoga, and wherever there is Arjuna, the supreme archer, there also will surely be opulence, victory, prosperity, and sound morality. This is my opinion.
